title: Vulcan on track as ULA eyes early-2021 test flight to the Moon
Northrop Grumman test fires first GEM-63XL motor for ULA’s Vulcan
Northrop Grumman completes ground test of solid booster for ULA’s Vulcan Centaur
With further delays to BE-4 rocket engine, Vulcan may not make 2022 debut

title: Vulcan continues path to its maiden launch as ULA turns 15
summary: On December 14, 2006, a Delta II rocket launched from VAFB (Vandenberg Air Force Base) SLC-2 (Space Launch Complex 2) on the NROL-21 mission. This launch marked the first mission for ULA (United Launch Alliance) and the beginning of its 15-year history.

title: Star Trek tribute mission to fly on ULA’s Vulcan inaugural launch
summary: Celestis, a company that provides space memorial services, will launch a Star Trek tribute mission on the first flight of United Launch Alliance’s new rocket Vulcan Centaur, ULA announced Jan. 26.

title: Vulcan Centaur on schedule for first launch in 2022 as New Glenn slips
summary: United Launch Alliance remains confident that its Vulcan Centaur rocket will make its first launch this year while Blue Origin is pushing back the first flight of its New Glenn vehicle.

title: Astrobotic lunar lander on track for late 2022 launch
summary: Astrobotic Technology showed off its nearly complete lunar lander it is building for NASA’s Commercial Lunar Payload Services (CLPS) program and said the spacecraft remains on schedule to launch this year.

title: The large Vulcan rocket is unlikely to make its debut in 2022
summary: ULA has a lot riding on this first Vulcan flight.

title: United Launch Alliance's debut Vulcan mission slips to 2023 -CEO
summary: United Launch Alliance has pushed the debut launch of its new Vulcan rocket to early 2023 at the request of one of its customers, the company's chief executive said, further delaying a benchmark mission crucial to the Boeing-Lockheed joint venture's launch business.

title: Amazon to launch two Project Kuiper satellites on Vulcan’s first flight
summary: The first two satellites of Amazon’s Project Kuiper broadband constellation — Kuipersat-1 and Kuipersat-2 — will launch on the maiden flight of United Launch Alliance's new Vulcan Centaur rocket

title: Astrobotic lander undergoes tests ahead of launch
summary: Astrobotic’s first lunar lander has passed a key set of acceptance tests, keeping the spacecraft on schedule for a launch in early 2023.

title: NASA’s commercial lunar program ready to start flying in 2023
summary: The NASA Commercial Lunar Payload Services (CLPS) program is on the verge of flying its first missions to the lunar surface this year after delays caused by the COVID-19 pandemic and other factors. CLPS will deliver science to the lunar surface in support of the Artemis human lunar program and was announced in April 2018 with nine companies winning the right to bid on CLPS contracts that November.

title: Astrobotic completes Peregrine testing
summary: Astrobotic Technologies said that it has completed testing of its Peregrine lunar lander and it ready to ship it to Cape Canaveral for launch.

title: When will United Launch Alliance’s Vulcan rocket fly?
summary: The Peregrine lander is ready for launch. Sort of.

title: ULA Now Targeting May 4th For Vulcan Launch
summary: ULA is now officially targeting May 4th for the maiden flight of Vulcan Centaur.

title: ULA announces May launch of first Vulcan
summary: The first launch of United Launch Alliance’s Vulcan Centaur rocket is now scheduled for no earlier than May 4, a date the company says is based on remaining tests of the rocket and its main engines as well as launch windows for its primary payload.

title: ULA Rolls First Vulcan Rocket To The Pad Ahead Of Testing Campaign For Launch
summary: After stacking inside the Vehicle Integration Facility (VIF) in late January, United Launch Alliance (ULA) has rolled out their newest rocket - Vulcan Centaur - to Space Launch Complex-41 (SLC-41) for a testing campaign ahead of launch.

title: ULA Completes Vulcan Tanking Test, WDR Next
summary: The United Launch Alliance (ULA) team has completed the next phase of testing in preparation for the inaugural Vulcan rocket flight.

title: Space Force in wait-and-see mode as ULA continues to investigate upper-stage anomaly
summary: The head of the U.S. Space Force launch program, Maj. Gen. Stephen Purdy, said he has been briefed by United Launch Alliance on an anomaly experienced last month during testing of the Centaur upper stage of ULA’s new rocket Vulcan Centaur.

title: ULA prepares for new round of Vulcan tests
summary: United Launch Alliance plans to resume tanking tests of its Vulcan Centaur rocket and test fire its main engines as early as next week, the company announced May 11.

title: Rocket Report: SpaceX hits success milestone, Vulcan to resume testing
summary: "If we’re going to have sovereign space capabilities ... we need somewhere to launch from."

title: Vulcan conducts launch day dress rehearsal as the final Delta IV Heavy arrives at Cape Canaveral
summary: Action finally returned to the United Launch Alliance’s (ULA) Space Launch Complex 41 (SLC-41) as the Vulcan-Centaur rocket rolled out to the pad on May 11 for further testing ahead of its debut flight. Meanwhile, ULA offloaded its final Delta IV Heavy rocket from their Rocketship vessel.

title: ULA preparing for Vulcan Centaur static fire
summary: United Launch Alliance expects to conduct a static-fire test of its Vulcan Centaur rocket in several days, but the timing of the vehicle’s first launch will depend on the outcome of an ongoing investigation of a test anomaly.

title: ULA To Roll Back Vulcan Rocket, Flight Readiness Firing Delayed
summary: ULA has announced a last-minute delay in the engine flight readiness testing for its highly anticipated Vulcan rocket. The test fire, originally scheduled for today, was halted approximately three hours before the planned ignition.

title: ULA To Conduct Vulcan Flight Readiness Firing Today
summary: ULA announced this afternoon that they are planning to conduct another attempt at the Flight Readiness Firing of the twin BE-4 engines of their next generation Vulcan-Centaur launch vehicle today.

title: Vulcan performs static-fire test
summary: United Launch Alliance carried out a static-fire test of its Vulcan Centaur rocket June 7, one of the final milestones before the vehicle’s first launch.

title: Vulcan aces engine test, but upper stage anomaly will delay launch for a while
summary: "Working corrective action and retest."

title: ULA Completes Vulcan FRF Test
summary: The United Launch Alliance successfully test fired the BE-4 engines for its new Vulcan rocket on the launch pad yesterday. The company is still investigating what happened in an earlier […]

title: First Vulcan launch further delayed for Centaur modifications
summary: The inaugural launch of United Launch Alliance’s Vulcan Centaur rocket faces new delays after the company said it needs to make “minor reinforcements” to part of the Centaur upper stage.

title: Centaur Upper Stage Delays ULA Vulcan Maiden Flight
summary: United Launch Alliance (ULA) has announced further delays for the inaugural launch of its Vulcan Centaur rocket due to necessary modifications to the Centaur upper stage.

title: ULA’s Vulcan Upper Stage Needs Mods Before First Launch
summary: The first launch of the United Launch Alliance’s Vulcan rocket will be further delayed because the Centaur V upper stage needs modifications. ULA had targeted May 4 for that inaugural […]

title: United Launch Alliance delays maiden Vulcan Centaur launch
summary: Following the anomaly investigation into the Centaur V upper stage, United Launch Alliance is de-stacking the Vulcan Centaur rocket and shipping the...

title: Here come the Moon landing missions (probably)
summary: Three for NASA, and one each for India, Russia, and Japan.

title: Centaur modifications push first Vulcan launch to fourth quarter
summary: United Launch Alliance is now planning a first launch of its Vulcan Centaur rocket in the fourth quarter after the company completes modifications to and testing of the upper stage.

title: ULA’s Vulcan to Launch By End of This Year
summary: Tory Bruno, president and CEO of the United Launch Alliance, said today that the Vulcan rocket will be ready to launch by the end of the year. The root cause […]

title: ULA sets Christmas Eve launch date for first Vulcan Centaur
summary: LAS VEGAS — United Launch Alliance now plans to launch its first Vulcan Centaur rocket on Christmas Eve, carrying a commercial lunar lander. The company announced Oct. 24 that the […]

title: Astrobotic lander arrives at launch site
summary: Astrobotic’s first lunar lander has arrived in Florida for final preparations for launch on Christmas Eve.

title: United Launch Alliance begins final preparations for debut launch of Vulcan
summary: United Launch Alliance recently announced they are targeting to launch its new Vulcan rocket on Christmas Eve and are in the midst...

title: ULA chief on the Vulcan rocket: “The path to flight one is clear”
summary: "We are expecting Blue to keep up with us."

title: ULA gearing up for first Vulcan launch
summary: All the major components for the first Vulcan Centaur rocket are now at the launch site as United Launch Alliance prepares for a launch in late December.

title: ULA chief says Vulcan rocket will slip to 2024 after ground system issues
summary: The Colorado-based launch company will end 2023 with just three launches.

title: First Vulcan launch likely to slip to January
summary: The first launch of United Launch Alliance’s Vulcan Centaur is likely to be delayed to early January to give the company time to complete a full dress rehearsal.

title: First ULA Vulcan Launch Apparently Slips to January
summary: Tory Bruno, President and CEO of the United Launch Alliance, posted on X today that the first launch of ULA’s new Vulcan rocket “likely” will not take place on Christmas […]

title: Three Lunar Landers Target Arrival in January
summary: 2024 is shaping up to be a year of triumphant lunar return, with several missions planned to welcome in a new age of international exploration of Earth’s nearest neighbor. This first wave consists of numerous robotic explorers, each set to demonstrate new capabilities that will ultimately benefit the next human explorers to walk on the surface as part of the Artemis Program. Coincidentally, three of these landers aim to reach the moon around the same time: Astrobotic’s Peregrine, Intuitive Machines’ Nova-C and JAXA’s SLIM, with projected touchdowns in January.

title: Vulcan Targets January 8th for Debut Flight
summary: After completion of a successful Wet Dress Rehearsal this week, United Launch Alliance’s Vulcan rocket is one step closer to its debut – entering a new chapter of American rocketry for both military and civilian space launch. The company now hopes to launch their Certification-1 mission carrying the Astrobotic Peregrine lunar lander no earlier than January 8th, 2024 at 2:18 AM Eastern Time.

title: ULA’s Vulcan Debut Set for January As Year of Lunar Landers Begins
summary: The United Launch Alliance was hoping to close out 2023 with the inaugural launch of the new Vulcan rocket, but it is not to be. The company confirmed today it […]

title: Peregrine lunar lander ready for January launch
summary: Astrobotic’s first lunar lander is ready for a launch in early January that would set up a landing on the moon in late February.

title: Rocket Report: Vulcan stacked for launch; Starship aces test ahead of third flight
summary: "We look forward to flying our next crewed flight soon."

title: ULA Ready for Inaugural Vulcan Flight
summary: United Launch Alliance (ULA) is preparing for the inaugural flight of its new Vulcan rocket from Space Launch Complex (SLC) 41 at the Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida. Liftoff is currently scheduled for Jan. 8, 2023, at 2:18 AM EST (07:18 UTC).

title: Launch Roundup: Vulcan attempts maiden flight, SpaceX continues launching Starlink
summary: During the week of Jan. 4 to Jan. 10, the long-awaited maiden flight of the United Launch Alliance’s (ULA) Vulcan rocket will take place, carrying the Peregrine Mission One Lunar Lander to the Moon. Two Chinese rocket launches are also expected, although there is currently conflicting information regarding these status of the launches.

title: Biden Administration to Consult with Navajo About Human Remains on the Moon
summary: NASA said today the Biden Administration will consult with the Navajo Nation about its concerns that human remains are being placed on the Moon on landers developed through the agency’s […]

title: NASA instruments set to fly on Peregrine commercial lunar lander
summary: As NASA prepares for the first launch of a commercial lunar lander carrying agency-sponsored payloads, it is trying to balance the science it can achieve with the challenges of landing on the moon and other emerging concerns.

title: As Vulcan nears debut, it’s not clear whether ULA will live long and prosper
summary: This marks an absolutely pivotal moment for the 20-year-old launch company.

title: Vulcan on the pad for its first launch
summary: After a decade of development, United Launch Alliance’s Vulcan Centaur rocket is finally on the launch pad for its inaugural launch, carrying not just a lunar lander but also the company’s future.

title: Vulcan Rolls to Pad Ahead of Debut Flight
summary: On Friday, January 5, United Launch Alliance’s Vulcan rocket rolled to the pad for the first time, ahead of its first flight scheduled for January 8, 2024. This pad roll represents the culmination of nearly a decade and a half of development work across the American aerospace industry, ringing in a new era for modern rocketry.

title: Vulcan to launch Peregrine lunar lander on inaugural flight
summary: United Launch Alliance(ULA) is preparing to return the US to the Moon with the launch of Astrobotic’s Peregrine lunar lander atop its brand-new Vulcan Centaur rocket.
